citeinfo.origin: Ralph Hunter (Retired) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
citeinfo.title: Depositional and Erosional Features of the Inner Shelf, Northeastern Bering Sea

abstract.p: Sonographs and bathymetric profiles from water depths less than 15m in the Nome-Solomon, Port Clarence and Yukon Delta areas of the Alaskan Bering Sea coast show features generated by waves, currents and drifting ice. The surface sediments in the Nome-Solomon and Port Clarence areas range in grain size from sand to boulder gravel and have many surface features visible on sonographs, where the sediments off the Yukon Delta are fine sands and silts that have few such features.
[Reference: Hunter RE, Thor DR, Swiwher ML (1982) Depositional and erosional features of the inner shelf, northeastern Bering Sea. Geol Mijnbouw 61:49-62.]
This volume may be found at many university libraries.

descript.purpose: A report showing the depositional and erosional features of the inner shelf, northeastern Bering Sea.
